turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Blood on the Bricks (Aldo Nova album).
turn.1: What was special about the album Blood on the Bricks?
turn.2: Blood on the Bricks (Aldo Nova album) Blood on the Bricks is the fourth studio album by Canadian singer, songwriter and multi-instrumentalist Aldo Nova, for which he signed to Jon Bon Jovi's Jambco Records.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: It was his first album in 6 years.
turn.5: Why did he take a hiatus?
turn.6: The album featured fewer outside writers than his previous record, "Twitch".
turn.7: Did any other artists collaborate with him?
turn.8: The songs were mostly written by Nova and Jon Bon Jovi, with help from Jim Vallance and Rick Hughes of Canadian metal band Sword.
turn.9: What were some of the demos?
turn.10: Throughout 1990 Jon and Aldo demoed a number of songs which would later be circulated as bootlegs.
turn.11: What were some of the songs?
turn.12: The songs are Desire, The Mission, Hanging on a Heartbeat, Burn Like the Sun, Little Wild One, and Hey Johnny which is an earlier version of Hey Ronnie.
